c:
Doctor, it hurts when I do this!

Then don't do that...

I'm a firm believer in creating documentation with examples that follow defined behaviour. Of course, the PHP manual also gives us the wonderful capability of user notes, which is where the person in your situation found his example:

""" Watch out for putting spaces in the DSN mysql:host=localhost;dbname=test works mysql: host = localhost; dbname=test works mysql: host = localhost; dbname = test doesn't work... """

And with that, the sheep are lead astray.

Some days (many days) I wonder whether the default view of the manual should be with user notes turned off.
